results.title: Wagga Wagga
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”
Shows family life and the rural, industrial and commercial interests of the city of Wagga Wagga, NSW. Also covers sporting, cultural and recreational activities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Sydney
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Presents many and varied aspects of life in Sydney including business and industrial activities, shops and supermarkets, play centres, schools and universities, hospitals and the rapid growth of new buildings. Shows the various recreational choices including football, cricket, surfing, yachting, fishing or just strolling in the beautiful parks and gardens and evening entertainment in the famous Kings Cross with its multitude of night clubs, restaurants and discotheques.

results.title: Perth
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
A pictorial story with minimum commentary on the city of Perth. The daily newspaper is used as the medium to reflect, social, business and sporting activities of the average Australian family living in the city of Perth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Lewes, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Douglas White, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
This film, directed by Douglas White, opens to the roar of a crowd at the MCG. The camera then sweeps across the city of Melbourne as the soundtrack fades to an easy listening score by composer George Dreyfus (notable for his TV score works like the classic theme from Rush). The film has no commentary, just a skeleton narrative, which is ingeniously used to feature the city of Melbourne. We see a young man wave goodbye to his mum and drive past the commission flats to pick up his girlfriend (Meg from “Prisoner” - the young Elspeth Ballantyne). In the city, people work and shop and the music turns more dramatic as the crowds and traffic grow. In the evening the couple window shop for funky furniture and see “Busybody” at Her Majesty’s, then twist the light fantastic at a bar. Part of the Life in Australia series, produced by The Australian Commonwealth Film Unit.

results.title: Launceston
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Young, W. H. Shepherd, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Aspects of life in Launceston. Industries include Paton and Baldwins woollen mills, Repco ball bearing factory, timber mills and furniture manufacturers. Shows schools, the general hospital, churches, and the historic home of Entally built in 1820. Motor racing at Longford, bicycyle racing, water skiing and archery are popular forms of recreation. Theatres, restaurants and night clubs, provide a variety of evening entertainment.

results.title: Geraldton
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Geraldton, Western Australia, is a fast developing town as it is the major supply centre and port of the north of the state. A glimpse of the people, industries, such as building and crayfishing, and social life of Geraldton.
